sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with non-square matrices

Solve the following system of linear equations using matrix multiplication:

3x - 2y = 5

4x + 7y = 15

2x + y = 4

The given system of linear equations is:

3x - 2y = 5
4x + 7y = 15

The determinant of A (det(A)) is not possible to calculate since A is a 3x2 matrix. The inverse of a matrix is only possible for square matrices (i.e., matrices with the same number of rows and columns).
